knimeNode.name: Entropy Uncertainty Scorer
knimeNode.shortDescription: Calculates the entropy uncertainty score of a class probability distribution.

fullDescription.intro: Calculates the entropy uncertainty score of a class probability distribution. Input are rows containing class probabilities P = p1, p2, ..., pn that must sum up to 1. Output will be the normalized Shannon entropy . This is defined by E(P) = H(P) / log(n) with H(P) = - sum(p_i*log(p_i) for each i in 1,...,n. The logarithm with base 2 is used. The normalization leads always to values between 0 and 1. A uniform probability distribution (i.e., most uncertain as all probabilities are equal to each other) has an entropy value of 1. If one of the class probabilities is 1 and the others 0, the highest certainty is given and the entropy value will be 0.
fullDescription.option: Include the columns containing the class probabilities. The values must sum up to 1 for each data row.
Set the name of the appended output column.

Specify the action if a data row of the input is invalid. Invalid could mean a missing value in the input or an invalid distribution (the probabilities must sum up to 1). If fail is selected, the node will fail. Otherwise, the node just gives a warning and puts missing values in the output for the corresponding rows.

ports.inPort: Table containing two or more columns containing class probabilities that sum up to 1.
ports.outPort: Input data with an appended column that contains the uncertainty score.
